root.name: Metal Slader Glory
root.description: OverviewMetal Slader Glory is an adventure game that was created by HAL Laboratory for the Famicom. The game was released on August 30, 1991 and was the last game made by HAL before the company was purchased by Nintendo. Manga artist Yoshimiru Hoshi created the game's story and character designs which were all partially based off his 1984 manga called Akutenso Fixallia. HAL Laboratory spent four years developing Metal Slader Glory and packed the game into a huge eight megabit cartridge, making it the largest game released for the system.
